Stellan Skarsgård (Prof. Gerald Lambeau) who takes up the challenge of refining the Gold ore that he mined shows great patience. One would really feel for him and his passion for math, especially if ur a lover of math.This is one of the best stories and a very well sketched script. Go get a DVD.

This drama features great acting, storytelling, and direction.  Though the story may be somewhat familiar and predictable, the actors draw you into their lives and characters so that we care about what happens to them. This is an excellent feel-good film!...10/10.

Review title: Superlative. I don't understand why people dislike it.
Review_body: This movie is absolutely amazing; raw human drama, intense acting, well-structured script and a touching ambience with witty dialogues carried out with a grace and natural fluidity that I haven't seen on-screen for a long time.Two big thumbs up.

This is the best movie I have seen since the Godfather. Matt Damon and Ben Affleck make a great team...not only as actors, but more impressively as co-writers. Add Robin Williams in perhaps his best role ever (too close to Good Morning Vietnam for me to make the call), and you have a wonderfully entertaining movie.Ben Affleck is convincing as the best friend to a genius, able to effectively play the joker and the friend who would "lay down in traffic for you". Matt Damon's portrayal of that genius realizing that life has something more to offer than batting cages and bars is equally stunning. And Robin Williams certainly leaves nothing to be desired (except maybe a beard trimmer...).The most amazing thing about this movie is the writing. Even if the acting were not terrific, this movie still would have made my top ten list. I was captivated from beginning to end.If you've not seen it, Good Will Hunting is without doubt a "renter", and I think after seeing it, it's one you'll want to own to watch again and again.

Review title: Undoing trauma in a guarded up boy.
Review_body: Damn, i would watch the sequels of this movie just to see the relationship unfold. It shows you the stuff that matters in life, how people are hurting and how much of the ego we have to lose to be on their side, just for the chance of getting through.

Review title: The best movie I've ever seen
Review_body: This movie hits it out of the ballpark for me. First off all, the script is absolutely incredible. Affleck and Damon have written an amazing story that compares to no other and really tugs at your heartstrings without, in any way, being soppy, gushy, or unrealistic. Yes, there is a lot of profanity, but that is real life! People swear! If you look past the four-letter-words, you'll be able to see all this movie has to offer.The acting is also incredible. Robin Williams was stunning in his performance as Sean. I had never seen him do a serious role before I saw this film, and he blew me away with his talent. Matt Damon also shines.The movie is completely compelling and absolutely beautiful. And, I don't often cry during movies, but the scene where Will breaks down crying in Will's arms really gets me. Honestly, it's my favorite scene I've ever seen in any movie.

Review title: Wonderful vehicle for every actor involved
Review_body: Good Will Hunting is a wonderfully paced, highly engaging drama that focuses on each character with painful emotional authenticity. I mean, literally, painful. The human struggles facing Matt Damon and Robin Williams' characters are so universal and beautifully realized. Every man must face one of their points of view, at some point. The hurt that Robin portrays is touching, sad and moving. You never see his wife. He just reminisces of her and it couldn't have felt more real. The subtleties in Robin's performance in this film are breathtaking as he laughs, cries and has his patience pushed over the edge.I really cannot imagine a better filmmaker to direct this picture than Gus van Sant. The way in which he portrays the troubled gifted young man, Will Hunting, cannot only be seen in this film, but in Elephant, as well. His ability to direct young talent is seen in the handling of Matt Damon as a new actor; the fearlessness with which he tackled demanding emotional close-ups and expressive subtlety is remarkable. The plot setup is traditional, yet flawless, with a slow reveal of more dense emotional conflicts in an eventual, memorable series of climactic peaks involving Will's closest acquaintances.Structurally, I do not think Good Will Hunting breaks any new ground. That is fine. If you are expecting a new type of storytelling or narrative formula, don't.Any lack of narrative experimentation is completely overshadowed by the powerful performances provided by every single cast member, except for Ben Affleck. Nothing personal, I actually like him, but, in this film, he is still clearly a new actor with potential to be achieved. He undoubtedly holds the reigns on one of the single most emotionally charged moments of the film, but, just doesn't shine in my opinion. Affleck is perfectly likable and I would say he was well cast - I don't think his chops were quite on Damon's level yet, though, which only became obvious in the latter half of the film.The tension of everyone's intellect crashing together is a real treat. Typically, this kind of heightened drama is based on violence or stunts, but, the way Good Will Hunting carries its highly taut narrative is through the intellectual conflicts amongst some very smart characters, not through empty spectacle. It was nice to see the love interest as a highly educated equal to the male lead and not a damsel-in-distress. She challenges Will emotionally and intellectually, something he is not used to in his even closest of relationships. You can understand everyone's point of view whether you disagree with them or not.Damon, Williams, and Skarsgard's roles are highly charged and particularly well executed. They all deserve major recognition for their acting talent in this film.

The only thing i knew about this movie before i saw it was that it had a lot of swear words in it. I don't really care to see movies I Don't know much about but I decided to give this one a try none the less.To sum it up in a few words, I was Blown away.From the acting to The Oscar winning screenplay this movie will touch you in a truly unique way. The movie starts of with Will Hunting (Matt Damon) going through is ordinary day to day life, which is filled with hanging round with his buddies, his part time job as a janitor and brutally beating up jerks. Although is high intelligence is apparent and shown through all this you can't help but wonder whats really wrong with this troubled genius. So after the Math professor of the collage catches him solving some the impossible sums he set for his class, he decides to bail him out from prison (kicking a cop in the crouch will get you there pretty quickly no matter how smart you are). So Will is bailed only under certain conditions which are that he must attained a weekly math class with the professor and meet a psychiatrist twice a week. Although the math classes are working out well, Will is convinced the does not need a psychiatrist and makes sure that all best possible options turn tale and head out the door. Thus the professor his forced to go to his former collage room-mate for help. This is where me meet Robin Williams in his Oscar winning role of a troubled psychiatric with his own troubled past.This is where the movie lingers on and has we try do go deeper into Will thoughts we find more and more about the other people in his life whom he seems to have a profound effect on. Something people will notice is how Will's problems in his life are not so much different than ours and with Gus Van Sant's brilliantly simply direction it is shown with more heart than you can handle. As Will goes through problems with his love life, his past and what his future hold for him, we realize his life his a potential that all our lives should be. Apart from this each character is superbly distinguished as each play a different role in Will's life which is one of the many fine touches of the screenplay. This movie is almost all dialogue and the dialogue is pretty heavy most times thus not making it appealing to everyone's taste (which movie really is) but I highly recommend it as it one of the few movies that by the end of it you'll either smile or cry because you will look back at your life in truly different way.

Review title: A young man's fascinating and complex journey to find himself
Review_body: Ben Affleck and Matt Damon wrote and starred in the film, "Good Will Hunting" which put them on the map in Hollywood. Matt Damon plays Will Hunting a brilliant young man working as a janitor at MIT in Boston. One day while cleaning he stumbles upon a equation that had been given to graduate students as a challenge. He is able to solve the problem and gains the interest of a professor. Even though Will is brilliant he is from a poor part of the Boston suburbs and has some trouble with the law. After an altercation with a police officer the professor tries to help Will achieve his potential by steering him in the right direction. As part of the deal Will must see a therapist played by Robin Williams. During therapy sessions Will learns about himself and deals with his past. Along the way he falls in love and struggles to determine what is important to him. The acting in this film is superb. Robin Williams won the academy award for best supporting actor. This film also won an Oscar for best writing screenplay. I love this film because it showcases the complexity of life and ones life is made up of choices.

I was amazed by this film. A story of a young man ,who has a brilliant mind, but finds it easier to use his fists in any situation. I was very engrossed by this film, especially when Damon, the main character and Williams, his psychiatrist have sessions together, discussing Hunting's painful past.The romance between Minnie Driver's character and Matt Damon's is very gentle, which helps the audience to relate t them as characters. The only thing I objected to was the amount of unnecessary use of swearing. Swearing is often used for dramatic impact and effect or to portray the society in which a film is set , but I found the fact that every other word was a swear word quite off putting and useless. Other than that I found the film enjoyable and humorous in just the right places. My favourite part is the scene with Williams and Damon where both men embrace and Damon's emotional barrier is cracked, allowing him to be liberated from his brutal past. Affleck's part is easily as important as Hunting's friend. Such sensitivity. What a beauty!!!!!!!!

It makes you laugh and cry. Couldn't believe how powerful this movie is. Great acting, writing,, and directing. Terrific ending. Loved the music. They don't make movies like these anymore. Why? It comes from the heart that what makes this film so compelling. Movies today are cheaply written and made. They cater to the lowest common demoninator of people in our live lives not worthy of anything. See this movie and it will enlighten you. Definitely worth watching a second and third time. Highly recommend renting it on DVD. Good premise and storyline. The location was also excellent in Boston. See this film! It is a must-see and deserved all the Oscars.

Review title: Matt Damon's best work as an actor and writer
Review_body: Good Will Hunting was written by Matt Damon for a film class in college. At the time, he did not even think he had put all of his potential to use. Despite this, Matt Damon crafted this masterpiece, and it fittingly marks the beginning of his very successful film career. Will Hunting is a genius who seemingly has misused his talents. It seems he is not motivated to pursue his talents and instead takes a carefree method of going about life. He often is getting in trouble and is surrounded by the wrong kinds of people. It turns out Will is facing a problem much deeper than lack of interest, which requires the help of a therapist (Robin Williams). Will Hunting's chemistry with Robin Williams defines the rest of the film. The genius of Will Hunting is clearly present but it never shines due to his psychological problems. His relation with his therapist allows Will to develop as a character, which is particularly nice to see. The film is shot really well with some emotional scenes. Even though the character of Will Hunting is portrayed as a difficult person to deal with, I was able to connect well with the character and his growth. As with his later movies, Matt Damon was saved against insurmountable odds. However, here is saved psychologically from his traumatized past. Good Will Hunting surely saves Matt Damon just as he begins his remarkable Hollywood career.

Review title: Some people may feel very related to this movie
Review_body: This movie has a lot of talking. For those who doesn't like movie which has it's power on the narrative and dialogue, this movie just doesn't for you. However, if you just sit down for two hours and pay attention to the story, you will definitely be touched. Good Will Hunting is uplifting but in the same time heart-breaking. The portrayal of Will Hunting is just so REAL, I am sure that many people are related to his personality and character, and so do I. For those who has a bad past in their life, and became more defensive and always pretending that you are a strong and complete person, please watch this movie. This will open your eyes, that sometimes you just have to lower your pride and ego, and be opened to other people so they can help you.

Review title: just a great film... every time!
Review_body: This is one of those films, no matter how many time you watch it, it never goes dull.To cut this short, when you watch it for the first time, make sure you are alone or with only other film freaks! Then watch it again with the deleted scenes added and then AGAIN! with commentary added.The Bar scene is a winner, where we get to meet Miss Drivers character, Skylar. I have tried Will's chat up line myself, but with no joy!Also, i heard that the Dog Track scene, mini Driver actually placed a bet on the dog that won the race in the film, hence a smile on camera that cant not be staged!If you like (simple) but very real films you will love this first film by both Ben & Matt. Another Gus Van Sant masterpiece as well.

I first watched this film on DVD after recognizing the title at the local video store. I was pleasantly moved. it is now one of my favorite movies. as i am sure many others were, i was shocked and initially a little doubtful upon hearing that the screenplay was written by Damon and Affleck, and couldn't help thinking that perhaps the latter's input was the occasional pizza run and neck massage for Matt's writers block. i am not a Ben affleck fan and use his name in the credits as a sign to steer clear but he doesn't manage to cripple the subtle magnificence of this picture. will hunting is a gem of a character, complex and heavily guarded, possessing a unique and superior gift and masking it with an arrogant mistrust in anyone but his four drinking buddies. robin Williams gives what i rate as his best cinematic performance as the only outsider to break through will's defenses and have any influence on his actions, using his own experience and surrendering his own covers to eventually gain wills trust and, in a poignant scene, releases will's true emotions and gives him the confidence to let himself do something with his gift. The effect that will has on every person he meets is relentlessly entertaining, whether it be the Harvard business student, the shrinks (and hypnotist), the other mathematicians, the job interviewers or Skylar. His un-rivaled knowledge and accompanying wit shape some hilarious and impressive scenes. when reading through the comments made about GWH i cant help but laugh while feeling sorry for those people giving one star and advising people to "avoid the hype". there are even a few people complaining about the language used. uuuuum, do you expect a person of will's background and lifestyle to speak in perfect English, avoiding profanities as to please those around him? the essence of the film is the character of will and his struggle to transcend the injustices of his upbringing. have the people making these comments any knowledge of movie history or prestige? the greatest movies made throughout history are those that step outside the boundaries and portray REALITY or a dramatized or sensationalized version of it. thats the beauty of cinema, we see the poignant moments of life portrayed in new and thought provoking ways. i advise anyone complaining over the language used to watch the likes of "a clockwork orange"; "goodfellas" ;or "shindlers list". these are great movies, high up on IMDb's top 250. i am not saying that GWH breaks any new ground in terms of explicit viewing because it doesn't; the language fits appropriately and any attempt to dull it down would ruin the essence of this masterpiece. I wont compare this movie to the heavyweights of cinematic history, because it doesn't need to be, GWH simply is a picture that must be seen, and WILL always be treasured by movie fans, it moves you in a way not many things can in the times we live in. The hype is just. "ordinary people" gave a similar message, but Good Will Hunting delivers it in astounding and unforgettable fashion. this movie is what superlatives were invented for.
Good Story Of A Lad And His Mentor And Then Goes Potential Polishing, Understanding The Real Inner would

Good Will Hunting is not about twist endings, drawn-out action scenes, or even a sappy romance. It has been knocked for being too predictable and trying to hard to pull the heart strings of its audience. . .Both are true.Still, the main reason this may be one of the best movies of the 90's is the deep, moving characters that Gus Van Sant has created. The characters YOU know.Each and every character is someone I know or can relate too. The genius who isn't living up to his potential. The man who has based everything he is on the woman he loved. The people who see the magic in someone, and can't stand to let it go to waste. Even the professor's assistant, the wonder kid whose been knocked of the top rung by a new wonder kid, I can relate to.Let it be known that the movie is going to turn out *exactly* the way you want it to. And let it be known that you'll probably have a tear in your eye before the credits roll. . .I wouldn't have it any other way.

Review title: A good editor away from being a masterpiece!
Review_body: I like the way I felt after I finished watching this film. Not in a happy Hollywood ending kind of way, more of a contented put my feet up thing. These days it seems that a film is either transparently contrived as a money making vehicle, pretentiously aimed at being an art piece or just plain bad! It was nice to see an excellent story done in an above average way! My only regret is that a few scenes were not left on the editing room floor. For example why was the "don't masturbate in my moms room scene there". Not because of the subject matter but because A: it wasn't interesting or well done and B: It had no connection with anything else that happened. It could have replaced with another interaction scene between Damon and Driver so that when all the, "I love you's" started flying around I wasn't left scratching my head and thinking, already! You may think I didn't like this flick. Wrong, it was excellent and I give it a nine!

Review title: If I hear the word *uck one more time!
Review_body: If you are crazy about the word *uck, you will love this movie because that is predominantly going to be all that you will hear.  Oh, and the scene with Minnie Driver in the bar giving her blow job joke is Oscar material. Puh-leeze!

Review title: Where did all the time go?
Review_body: Good Will Hunting is definitely one of those movies that you don't want to end.  I can't remember the last time I felt so much energy leaving the theater.  Diagolue and screenplay for the movie stand out in your mind for time to come....Can't wait to see Damon and Affleck's next masterpiece.

Review title: please - DON'T get carried away in the hype!
Review_body: Oh please.  What was the hype with this movie? It was yet more formulaic, contrived, saccharine, vacuous tripe.Many comments seem to refer to how 'moving' it was - a reference to the film's overly effusive pouting.  What ever happened to subtlety?And why go for such 'authentic' language in such an unrealistic film which never gains any credibility outside something being shot in a Hollywood studio?And this features so highly on the top 250 list??? Ye gods, watch some films which manage to genuinely convey some emotions a little closer to the world we live in.

Review title: Greatest movie to come along in a long time...
Review_body: I vehemently disagree with anonymous from Vancouver, Canada.  Good Will Hunting truly shines in our lackluster times of modern Hollywood movies. Matt Damon reminds me of Pacino of the 70's.  He is a young and a very talented actor that can hypnotize his audience almost at will.  This movie could not have been successful without the supporting cast of Williams and Affleck.  Driver may not be the "Cameron Diaz" but she is certainly a talented actress.  The scene at the lake with Robin Williams' "uncut" extended performance is just jaw-dropping.  The amount of depth in the character development and the complexities of the plot spun by this movie is just simply amazing and sensational.  This movie is an exclamation point. Good Will Hunting stood out from the crowd without a question.  Overall, I love this movie and would recommend it to everyone.

This movie is so predictable when you know the modern American dream: Do nothing, be a loser and then suddenly... whoah! You're a genius and an obnoxious one and the world is kissing the ground you are walking on.And surprisingly all the other smart people are losers. They don't know anything and are bitter when our wonderkid solves problems so easily. And what kind of problems? They are so difficult but still these professors can analyse the results in less than 10 seconds.Every movie has something good in it anyway and Robin Williams is it in this one.

Review title: ...Good Will Hunting is a diamond in the rough
Review_body: On a shoe-string budget, with a less than well-known cast, Good Will Hunting once again proves you don't have to spend a lot of money in Hollywood to produce a first rate movie with a first rate ensemble cast.  Matt Damon (Will Hunting) and Ben Afleck are buddies who wrote the Oscar winning screenplay together.  Damon also garnered a well-deserved Best Actor Oscar nomination. Minnie Driver (As Will's girlfriend Skylar) and Robin Williams (as Will's counselor Sean Maguire) were also nominated as Best Supporting Actress and Best Supporting Actor respectively.  Both are superb in their supporting roles.The plot concerns an MIT school janitor (Damon) from South Boston ("Southie") who has a special gift when it comes to numbers. Rather than apply that skill, Will prefers hanging out with his childhood friends drinking, getting  into fights and carousing with women.  When Will completes a mathematics equation posted for the "real" students at MIT, a math professor becomes curious and tracks down Will. Seeing his potential, he takes Will under his wing. As a condition of his freedom (Will's arrested for assault), Will must undergo therapy.  After running through "shrinks" like women run through nylons, the professor seeks out his old college roommate (Sean), also a hard case and when Will and Sean finally begin to trust each other, things change for Will in his thoughts about his future and in his relationship with Driver.Well-written, with a down to earth, realistic look at New England life, Good Will Hunting is a diamond in the rough.  With some of the best lines (had me laughing out loud) and well-crafted dialogue, this film soars above most of the movie fare. With a running time of 2:05, this film never drags and leaves you wanting more. For an uplifting, intelligent, thought-provoking and, most importantly, entertaining film, put Good Will Hunting at the top of your must see list.

I'm not trying to wax Siskel & Ebert here.  The movie caught my attention during the credits!  It was refreshing to view a movie, that no matter how unrealistic, still pulled at your heartstrings.  Come on, twenty-something is almost as bad as Junior High.  Watching the movie made me think that maybe I wasn't the only one questioning life in general.  If it didn't make you think for just one nano-second, then I'm sorry.  You totally missed something...

Review title: the most boring movie i have ever seen
Review_body: Good acting and production values are nothing if the movie puts you to sleep. I don't care about Will or his high IQ or his nappy girlfriend. Robin Williams is depressing. I liked him better as Mork.

The constant  profanity jarred rather than added realism, and did little more than distract and make it seem the actors were trying much too hard. Though Will may have been a genius, but the writers sure are not.  The formulas in this film are familiar to any 2nd Year maths student in university.  The performances and direction, however,  are very appealing, turning the cliched and typical plot into an enjoyable film.

That was my first time to see Matt Damon's movie. In spite of his age,his acting was really great! I was so impressed with his acting. And also,the supporting actor,Robin Williams's acting was terrific!I definitely think this movie couldn't get such many awards without him.He is one of the greatest actors in the world.I recommend many people to see this movie.After you see this movie,you can get something warmhearted.

Wonderful beautiful
Wonderful beautiful
Wonderful beautiful

This movie has a Marvelous script
The most amazing thing about This movie is the Writing. Even if the acting were not terrific. This movie still would have made my top ten list.(I was capticated from beginning to end)

Review title: a story that'll go with your grave.
Review_body:
"it's not your fault" one of the most iconic line ever produced by hollywood.
a story of a young exceptionally talented man looking for his path to live a better life and unable to do so due to problems he faced in the past and he found a man who actually change his life just by talking it out .movie is filled with fun,love and
lot of roller coaster of emotions nevertheless i make you sure that this movie won't fail to make your eyes wet.

Good Will Hunting is my favorite movie! I absolutely love it! Its the type of movie that anyone would love to see. Matt Damon and Ben Affleck wrote it and it is very well written and a great, great movie. Matt Damon in paticular was great in this movie, but the rest of the cast was excellent as well. You MUST see this movie :)

If your part of the younger audience (we'll say that you were born after this film was released) then this is an instant classic for you to watch. To watch a young Matt Damon and Robin Williams with this kind of storyline and dialogue is a absolute treat for us. I was born in 1998 and this is one of my favorite movies that was made before I was born. Highly recommend this classic movie!

I Love Robin Williams, and since this is usually regarded as his best performance I thought I would love this movie. It was awful. Williams is good but is given to little screen time, and all he does is talk about his wife. He was much better in Fisher King and Dead Poets Society. All the dialogue and everything that happens in this movie is incredibly unrealistic. Also the characters feel inauthentic.

This movie is just fabulous! I am a huge Mat Damon fan and he really shines in this one. The script is excellent and the performances are deeply heartfelt. This is a movie that I watch again and again as it makes me cry. Please Hollywood - make more moves like this!
Moved by the acting of Robin Williams. Great story.

Review title: GWH is a classic movie that it will never die.
Review_body: I don't know who wrote the script or not. Whatever background this movie has I don't really care. What I do care is that what I just seen is a 10 of 10. Everyone involved is great. Acting, Directing, writing, everything. Rest in Peace greatest actor of all time.
This film has my heart. It unveils how broken people can help each other. The personalities are so charming in the film you're bound to love it.

Besides, Will Hunting's great story, thoughtful conversations, developed characters' traits, attractive narrative, even some mathematical proofs, there is intriguing love story. The relationships between Will and Skylar is not a kind of relationship that only genius as Will might have. They loved each other, and both had struggle to accept this fact. For Will, as a mathematician he likes certainty in all things, and long relationships for him are uncertain. He keeps asking himself whether this girl is right choice and where he would be after. As for Skylar, she seeks for education and she needs from him confirmation of his love. The story tells that the right girl is the one for whom you are willing to sacrifice the most valuable thing. I personally find this idea attractive, because it seems to be one of the important decisions and there is only one moment in your life when you will have such feeling.

I think this may be Robin William's finest role. His eyes show such caring and such pain, just like his character. Sadly this may not have been completely the character, pointing to the beauty all the more. This story knows what it is, and sticks with it.

Review title: Brutal acting. Loved the acting really...
Review_body:
I will start saying that I didn't gave a 10 just because Will character was unbelievable: A mix of genious nerd, tough fighter and way cool guy. It was at least strange.Nonwithstanding what I've said this film is amazing. Perhaps you think the whole plot is "simple" and "predictable" but it was 1997. Besides 95% of nowadays movies have horrid and repetitive plots copying each other.I will base all my review on the acting is magnificent.I'm a very observant person. I have seen many movies before but there were so many scenes when I really felt the character feelings.a) When Will is Laughing so hard when talking with Sean (either is well played or someone told him a very good joke, no one can act such a good laugh)
b) Also Krystyn after telling his joke at the bar spilling the beer
c) When Chuckie is telling the story of the police and the guys were interrupting .. it looked SO real, It seemed they were a bit drunk to make it more realistic.
d) The most important when they are Will and Krystyn are in bed. Most of movies shows two characters with the classic stupid sex scene showing movements under blankets, feets, hands, kisses and then oh.. they were really there, laughing while - before or after having sex and having a conversaition, they looked like a couple.After all I said the movie is great because of how Sean find himself motivated to reach Will's heart. And he got it because he was special. The character never dissapoints.Some people might just prefer watching Jason Staham destroying faces with his fist or Incredible Hulk smashing War Taks but this film is amazing, don't deny it.

Review title: I really enjoyed this well-written movie.
Review_body: I thought that Ben Affleck and Matt Damon did a tremendously good job writing this movie. They both also did a good job acting in it. I also thought that Robin Williams deserved that Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor because he did an excellent job. Someone might wonder, do they really need to swear that much? But they do because Will and his friends are supposed to be living a tough life and you imagine that they would swear a lot. So because they do swear so much, that proves that Ben and Matt are very good writers and in my opinion they should write more scripts in the future, whether it's together or separate, even though they probably would do better together. So over all this movie was one of the best movies I've seen in a long time.

Good Will Hunting is one of the best movies I have ever seen!! Matt Damon is just wonderful! One of his best movies. If you haven't seen this movie, you need to see this movie!! I rate this movie as a 10!!!

Sometimes watching a movie with no idea of it whatsoever and hence having no particular expectations from it can be so generously rewarding. That was the case with my viewing of this "South Boston Drama" as I'd like to call it.My honest advice to anyone wanting to watch this movie is just close the web page you're viewing right now and get a copy of the movie and watch it. Instead of breaking my head in figuring out the best way to describe what the movie (which is now in my all-time favorite movie list)is about, I will tell you what it's not. It's not a pretentious movie that tells the story of some shallow people. It's not a movie which though has a great story but goes nowhere. It's not a drama which will make you cry every other scene. It's an honest movie which has got an amazing script that is portrayed beautifully by equally amazing actors. In fact there is a sense of honesty in every character you see in the movie, the lines they speak and even their attitude throughout... and that is the charm of it. Matt Damon and Ben Affleck's screenplay is way too good which got them a deserving Oscar. Robin William gives a spellbinding performance and is the one to watch out for.In all sincerity if you could just connect to this movie the way I did, maybe you and I are not so different after all. Pure honest movie-making rarely gets better than this.

Review title: HOW did this thing ever make money???
Review_body: I went with my wife to see this in the theater. When the plot failed to go anywhere after an hour, we left.I finally read the entire script, and haven't changed my opinion. Why should I care that this guy is throwing his life away? If he can't stay out of trouble, they should have just thrown him in jail. End of movie.0 stars out of 4.

Review title: Smart, funny and touching but not perfect
Review_body: I've watched this movie about 5 times and I have to say I really love this movie! It's about life and growing up! There are some very touching scenes with clever dialogue and GOOD acting. Robin Williams is perfect as the psychologist and Matt Damon is trustworthy, so is Ben Affleck. Minnie Diver is also acting good and you can truly say that it's something between them, the only bad thing is her laugh! But there are some flaws that makes this film not as perfect as it could have been. The fighting scene are just ridiculous and Casey Affleck is acting a little bit too "dumb". Cole Hauser isn't saying anything at all! Stellan Skarsgård is not convincing as a professor, especially in the scene where he thinks that the answer is wrong but Will says it's right and set the paper on fire. And there is something with his accent.. Anyway, apart from some stupid scenes this is a touching film! The ending is also very good, it's just so genuine! I gave this 8 out of 10.

I really liked this movie and i would recommend it to anyone who wants to watch something. Matt Damon, Robin Williams and Mini Driver give there best acting performances i have ever seen, an unique plot which works well and has a good ending.

*POSSIBLE EARLY FILM SPOILERS*After watching this movie, I plan to file suit against Damon & Affleck to get my two hours back.The characters are thoroughly unrealistic; never in my life have I met anyone who was anything like these people. Damon is thoroughly unconvincing as either a genius or a blue-collar working stiff, and certainly not as a combination of the two. Affleck is completely script dependent yet again, portraying one of his weakest characters yet. And Williams is at his worst.Please, Robin, stick to comedy and playing psychopaths, that's what you're good at. Not "serious" drama.But the sad thing? It's pretty obvious that neither Damon or Affleck took much college-level math. That first problem Will Hunting solves in the hallway can be done with just graph theory, combinatorics, and a little linear algebra. The first problem was trivial; anyone with some discrete math background should be able to solve it. Please, aspiring screenwriters, don't underestimate your audience. You never know who might be watching.

Review title: Daemon is a genius, Williams is the man who tries to tell him that
Review_body: Unless you wanna talk about you, who you are! Then I'm fascinated... I'm in! But you don't wanna do that do you? You are terrified what you might see...Daemon is a genius, Williams is the man who tries to tell him that. We see a boy become a man, twice actually. The film is about friendship, love, passion, following your dreams. It is soft yes, it is American indeed, but no film have ever done it like that to me. This film is real, the acting is marvelous, I believe in it, I want to believe that Will is alive, that Sean is a shrink, and that Skylar is devastated in love with this weird man/boy who does not know who he is.I love this film, nothing more to say :-)

It appears the jury is hung... many people either loved or hated this movie. I can tell you why I loved it. First of all the script. I think it had a real slice of life, and brilliance in it. Sorry, but some people do use 4 letter words to express themselves. And no, it doesn't mean that's because they lack intelligence to use anything else. I can rise to the occasion any time I need w/out profanity. But it is how I think & speak in my day to day life. The language shouldn't even be an issue. If that's all you heard, you weren't listening! The brilliance in it is everywhere. For example, William's character putting Damon's character in place by noting that he sneers at things that he has no real life experience with. I know people like that. Then moments when he (William's character) says gems like, "I'll save you the suspense sport- she isn't perfect & neither are you- the question is whether you are perfect for each other." I'm paraphrasing of course. The question of relationships, and life career decisions- the courage to risk and overcoming whatever your background is, are all a part of real life. This isn't supposed to be about genius or some "white trash" as someone else said (some people might say the kids in this movie aren't trash, just normal hard working, middle class guys) - it's about love, life and courage- courage to ante up & try again, no matter how many times life knocks us around. The acting, direction and script are wonderful. They definitely deserved the Oscar for this. It has soul. It has meaning & I am sad for the people that didn't get it. As the movie "American Beauty" said... LOOK CLOSER.

Review title: And it gave us Ben and Matt to boot
Review_body: I have seen this film 3 times, and find myself liking it more with each viewing. There is a lot going on throughout the story. It is a lot about growing up--a lot about finding the courage to better yourself, and accept who you are without listening to friends you love, but may be better without for a while. The Oscars that year must have been interesting---(is there any tape available for previous Oscar telecasts?). These two unknown children dominating the awards. It's just become a classic movie now. I like the story and the message it gives. I'm not too familiar with film school teachings, but obviously, these two must've done something right. Perhaps, the film school should examine their curriculm, eh?

Well..Much has been said and written about this fabulous movie..but the fact that every single person can relate to the movie is its USP..Not every one can be an achiever in life..or possibly come close to being one..But every one yearns to be a achiever..This movie conveys the message that "Its all in your mind.."..How many of us have scars engraved in our minds..It is up to the individual to get rid of these scars and try to achieve what he/she has set to out to do..This movie coveys this message to the core and that inspires me no end..Hats off to the director Gus Van Sant and Matt Damon & Ben Affleck for writing such an inspiring story..

The film that broke both Damon and Affleck in the big league was definitely one of my favourite films of the 90's.I would return to this film to watch Robin Williams character alone, he is simply outstanding as the shrink trying to get in to Will's (Damon) head, in particular he delivers a speech to Will sitting on a park bench that enchanted and amazed me.I like the idea of clever guys being made into hero's in films for a change rather than the burly action figures we see in the same types of movie year in year out.It is interesting looking back to see the different directions that Affleck and Damon's careers have gone, maybe neither of them will ever beat this moment.

Review title: I am a Medalist of the International Math Olympiad and this was boring.
Review_body: I am a Medalist of the International Math Olympiad and this was boring.

Good Will Hunting is about inspiration. Its about the "good" before "will hunting" which says every man is good, and he has got his history, and its all about bringing that "good" from a human being. Its about the connection between teacher and student, doctor and patient, father and son. 10/10.This story is kinda mystery, the more it unfolds the more it leaves for you to see and imagine. I liked the way it started, u know kids fighting and drinking and wooing girls blah blah, but it takes u for a ride when Robin Williams, which I felt was the best puller of the movie, comes into picture. Not surprising that he appears first while listing the cast, even though he appears among the lasts actually in the movie.Its about relationships. Its about friendship between Will and Chuckie. Its about love between Skylar and Will. Gerald and Sean are old friends, though they fight over silly principles and beliefs. Its about those fights. Will had no future before he met a mentor like Sean. Its about that bond. When Sean says "Good Luck, Son!", it means the depth of that teacher-student relationship.Everyone of the cast has done their jobs beautifully. Matt as Will is like a true brat, but smart, genius at the same time. Ben is wonderful. Wish everyone has a friend like him. Skylar is a smart girl, at the same time longing for love. She is beautiful too. Gerald the professor is really good in all of his work. Of course reminds me of college days. But the person who steals the show is Sean, played by Robin Williams. I liked him so much that I read a lot about him, probably I would check out his other movies too.All this tells u is "We have got answers for every damn question in others life, but what is more important is to get answers for those questions, when Its My Life!"

The double ego of maths genius and waste of space scrapper has been done before, it is a cliché now. However, this film is done well. The comparison between will (matt Damon) and his psychiatrist (robin Williams) is intriguing and nicely put together. Mini Driver plays the girl will wants, who is an intellectual who can merge into a group of lads, as when she tells the oap's 50th anniversary present joke. She also has a mean laugh!!! Will is an interesting character and he portrays the idea that even though you may have a skill, its not worth using it if its going to make you unhappy. You should do what will make you happy in life, as long as it doesn't hurt other people. Id happily watch this film again, its a romantic comedy,tame type of film you have cravings for sometimes.

Review title: Very nice psychological drama about a misunderstood genius
Review_body: Not the generic type of chic flick you would expect based on other reviews I have read. It's a very nice catching story about a guy who works as a janitor in my favorite city of Boston's MIT. He appears to be a genius in science which is discovered by an intelligent professor. He tries to guide and let Will bloom with the talents he has, along with the assistance of another professor and shrink Sean (Robin Williams), who has some problems of his own. The scenery of the movie in my view is simple and not diverse, but the story of the movie is so strong it is not a problem at all, it will keep you tight to the screen for the duration of the movie.The way Will's relationship with Skylar is waved into the movie is perfect. It's a good recommendation if you like a touching movie, which is very realistic telling you something about young adults in South Boston and the symptom of being misunderstood.Awesome, in one word.

"Good Will Hunting" tells the story of its titular namesake, a truly brilliant young man still struggling to cope with the demons of a dark past. Will's keen intellect, thirst for knowledge, and a tight- knit group of friends serve as his primary bulwarks against his troubles. Yet even these are unable to fully help Will. Will is unwillingly "discovered" by a senior MIT professor after he (easily) solves a complex algebra equation that proves to be the bane of student and faculty alike. Through this Will meets Sean (played by Robin Williams) a professor at a local community college who soon finds himself being one of the few people being able to meaningfully connect with Will. Along the way Will meets a sophisticated Harvard undergrad named Skyler. The two hit it off and begin a relationship, yet Will struggles to connect with her as his deep fear of abandonment prevent him from getting attached to her, let alone anyone, outside his "group." This fear hides within it a heavy reluctance to embrace his God-given gifts and realize his immense potential, and ultimately better his future. The story, the cast, the performances, the character dynamics, oh where do I begin???!!! I could rave about them all, but for fear of being redundant I will refrain from doing so. Go see this movie. It is such a wonderful film.

Review title: don't be afraid to live and love
Review_body: What I like about this movie is that it's very kind. It makes you believe in good people and good things.Will was a very gifted boy with a difficult childhood, who trusted nobody but his 3 best friends. They were his family, he would never leave them. Neither for a good and well-paid job, nor for the girl he loved.He didn't believe in this traditional values, like making a career or starting a family. He knew too well that people betray and can turn their back on you when you least expect. He had his life and wasn't gonna change anything.But then he was noticed by Prof. Lambeau who for some reason decided to help this very smart but rebellious boy. With his help Will met Dr. Maguire who not only was able to win Will's trust but also managed to encourage him to change something and try new things.«Some people can never believe in themselves, until someone believes in them»I like their conversation in the park, where Sean Maguire said that Will knew nothing about life. All his knowledge was too theoretical, borrowed from books, not from his life experience. He was afraid to open his heart to new people or new things. Eventually he found some peace as well as also Dr. Maguire who had been hiding from real life since the death of his wife.I liked Skylar, how open she was when she was talking about her feelings to Will, how honest and understanding she sounded. But still, I believe that the only reason why Will dared to change his life, was because his best friend Chuckie told him to do that. He kinda gave him permission. You should really care about someone to let the person go for his own good.I love the film, I love the performance. I never got the feeling it was some acting, they all were so real and genuine. Interesting plot, great acting, happy ending. It totally deserves THE 2 Oscars it got.

Directed by Gus Van Sant, Good Will Hunting is the story of a mathematical genius named Will Hunting, played by Matt Damon. The film takes place in the campus at MIT, where Hunting works as a janitor. One day after his class is over, mathematics Professor Lambeau writes a problem on the board that took several MIT professors two years to figure out, and challenges his students to solve it. When Hunting sees the problem, he solves it by himself in a matter of minutes. The movie then unravels the genius in him, but also portrays his many weaknesses and his rough childhood. One of my favorite aspects of this film is Hunting's relationship with the psychologist Sean, played by Robin Williams. Sean is persuaded by Lambeau to council and give advice to a metaphorically speaking "lost" Hunting, after Hunting gets sent away from five other counselors. Sean asks Hunting some thought provoking questions that lead him to pursue the dreams of his heart. Their relationship is like one of doctor and patient, as Hunting describes toward the end of the film. Sean tolerates him even after horrible disagreements and arguments they had with each other, and he never loses hope in him. Sean is one of the few people that actually understands Hunting, and why he does what he does. Unlike Lambeau, who often sees Hunting as an object of great power to be handled with force and control, Sean puts himself in Hunting's shoes and relates to him. For that reason, Hunting reciprocates this friendship and learns to trust Sean's judgement. A major portion of Hunting's actions at the end happen because of the advice that Sean had given him. Another great aspect of this film is the dialogue. The dialogue between few characters in this movie flows very naturally and really moves the story along. Whether it's between Hunting and his three closest friends, between Professor Lambeau and Sean, or between Sean and Hunting, the dialogue is incredibly real. A major theme in this movie is finding oneself, and finding what one really wants to do with his/her life. Talent and natural ability is one thing, but how will you use it? Will you just let it go to waste and stay comfortably in the status quo? Or will you go out and seek the adventures that your heart desires? Hunting has trouble identifying what his passions are, or what he wants to do with his life. When asked by Sean, Hunting cannot give a single straight answer. As far as I'm concerned, this film doesn't have any flaws, though some parts of the film may not be entertaining for everyone, and the beginning starts off quite slow. Other than that, I think people who enjoy watching classic films will love Good Will Hunting.After nearly twenty years since its release, Good Will Hunting remains one of the most powerful films ever made. This movie has a lot of heart, wit, and fun in it, though it revolves around a much more serious theme. This film is one of the few that can break your heart yet leave you smiling. Good Will Hunting is one of my favorite films of all time, and is definitely worth watching.

Review title: A Powerful Story with an Uplifting Message
Review_body: I can't stress enough how much this film means to me. Since my youth, I was always quite taken with Boston – Cambridge in particular. As a portrait of the academic culture's conflict with the working class culture, it can't be stressed enough that though there is something of a fairy tale quality to this, it captures the grit-teeth of the Boston working class quite convincingly. The story of the evolving relationship between Will (Damon) and Dr. Sean Maguire (Williams) is fraught with difficulty, but offers an honest reflection of the sobering power of friendship in the face of self-defeat brought on by child abuse. I think always in particular of this moment where Maguire speaks to Will and gives him the advice – that it's not his fault. We must remember this, through all our own traumas and abuses.

This movie actually surprised me. I was expecting a boring movie about math. But then i watched it and I have watched it at least 70 times since then, maybe more. Anyways if you haven't watched this movie then i recommend it to anyone who loves moving movies. 10 out of 10 easy. I personally love Matt Damon as an actor and he truly gives one of the best performances of his career. And if u love movies then I would like to recommend another movie, A Beautiful Mind. It stars Russel Crowe and he is absolutely amazing in the movie. All in all, Good Will Hunting is definitely a must see movie and is one of my favorites of all time. Thanks for reading. Hope u enjoy the movie of u watch it....

They sure don't make movies like this anymore. Not that they ever could. We'll never replace Robin. We'll never have 20's Damon back. This movie made careers. Even to some extent, Robin's career was greatly impacted by this movie - by the depth of character in which it is explored.

Review title: Such a relatable and emotional story
Review_body: I was sitting at home one day, and saw an ad for Good Will Hunting on TV. It was a movie that I had wanted to see for years, but never had the time to, so I got up still in my sleep clothes, grabbed my keys, walked outside, got in my car, and drove up to the video store. There was only one copy of it there, I asked the guy why so little, and his reply is,'People just usually steal it.' I thought that was sorta unusual considering that if you were gonna steal a tape from a video store, it'd Clerks, but I still hadn't seen it yet. So, I got home, poured out some nasquick, got some pop tarts, and popped in the tape, and sat down to watch it. During the film, I found myself on the brink of tears. The movie just hit so deep. The janitor that comes off as being some mischievous, beer guzzlin' guy, but is revealed as a brilliant person who has had a troubled past. Being an orphan. Being beaten as a children. Going from foster parent, to foster parent only to find more people that could pummel him. Then, he mets the therapist who can actually connect with him, and not just be another school counselor. This movie is just so emotional, and understandable that it just makes you think about life, and everything it's worth. It displays magnificent writing from Ben Affleck and Matt Damon, and amazing filming from Gus Van Sant. It is definitely a movie that one should rent or buy if they have not already witnessed its greatness.

At first the story centers around Will Hunting (Matt Damon) who is a brilliant young man and his struggles in life. Then we are introduced to a wonderful cast whom are only the best, Robin Williams, Ben Affleck, and Stellan Skarsgård. What you will enjoy the most it'll be the humor, the well-written dialogs, the passion, and even the emotions come off the screen. Only showing what would happen in reality, allowing us to see how others feel and go on in life, while still having some awkward moments and mature language (only us adults understand). As always genius Robin Williams demonstrates that you don't need to be over-dramatic, but have a piece of both fun and seriousness.In conclusion, well – If you really think that your life is worthless then renew yourself in this movie. It is very inspiring – Life is too short to throw it all away. Definitely recommended to everyone!

When you watch Good Will Hunting, you have to look past the Oscars and other awards it's gotten. Because beneath all that, it's a beautiful movie, with a beautiful script written by two talented young men and acted out by equally talented actors such as Robin Williams, Matt Damon and Ben Affleck.One of the most enjoyable parts of the movie was the psychological aspect. We have a typical 21 year old, going out and drinking with his friends, getting in fights etc., but underneath all that there's so much more to him. This movie tells us that we shouldn't look at the surface alone, there is so much more to people.The acting in this movie was incredible, Matt Damon played the role of Will Hunting without fault, he displayed the emotions, the cockiness, he displayed how Will was closed off due to his childhood trauma and he displayed how Will shrouded his weakness with smart talk and intellect. Robin Williams played the therapist Sean Maguire, a man who has seen life unlike the life his fellow academics have, on the battlefield in Vietnam. He recently lost his wife, who he regarded as his soulmate and best friend.Matt Damon plays Will Hunting, who is a brilliant young man who denies his out of this world genius. Will has had a very abusive childhood which hurt him mentally to a point where he can no longer let anyone close to him aside from his best friend who is played by Ben Affleck. That is until a professor at one of the top colleges finds Will's talent and helps him out of trouble with the law. Robin Williams later comes in as a therapist to Will, he is the only one who can really stand up to Will's intellect and manages to break the layer of distrust that Will has developed over years of solitude, and the two develop a bond beyond friendship. Yes there is a girl in the movie, but there isn't much focus on that aspect.The fact that most of the people keep on talking about the probability of someone being as smart as Will tells us that this is a story, that this isn't real. Even so it relates to almost everyone who has been at Will's age. They have dealt with insecurities, fear of not being accepted, etc.Overall, I think it's a beautiful movie, with a beautiful message and amazing effort from everyone in the cast and crew. Especially from Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, who co-wrote the script for this movie. It is definitely a must watch.

What a cliche! Poor and genius boy is noticed by a rich man, but poor boy is proud because of things that are in his past and denies the modern world and the richness. But then magical things happen. Our genius but poor boy turns a winner. Then he thanks everybody for his great life. THE END.I know, you see this scenario again and again. Here nothing is different. The only positive thing for this film is that it is well-acted. Nothing more...

Review title: Surprises on every corner, and astonishingly moving!
Review_body: This film is pretty damn moving. That's the best way I can figure out how to explain this movie. "Good Will Hunting", directed by Gus Van Sant, is about a young janitor named Will Hunting, played by Matt Damon, who ends up being a genius, and solves a very difficult math problem, which grabs the attention of a math professor, but Will has some pretty bad physiological issues leading him to be seen by a psychologist, played by the remarkable Robin Williams. If you have not watched this film, do not continue reading! (Unless you want this film to be spoiled for you) Trust me, you won't regret watching this. "Good Will Hunting" really surprised me. I was not expecting this to be such a moving film filled with some great performances. There is so much right in this film, but the first thing that really shines in my opinion is the score and soundtrack. Elliott Smith wrote many songs that are in this movie, and he happens to be my favorite musician. Miss Misery is the PERFECT theme for this film. The last scene in this movie is both extremely heart warming and unexpected. Miss Misery really turns this scene into a masterpiece. I am going to have to talk about the last scene, so if you haven't seen the movie, please go watch it, you will not regret it, trust me. The last scene shows Will gone, and his friend ends up going to his house and Will isn't there. This was super clever, because not even a few scenes back, his friend does say that one day he wishes he could just come knocking at his door, and he won't be there because he wanted to move on to bigger and better things. That's not all though. What really caught me off guard is how the film goes full circle, Robin Williams sees a note from Will, and it says exactly what Robin said in the past "I went to go see about a girl", and I started BALLING! The approach to making this film go full circle is amazing. It is just so unexpected, and really shows Will character ark shine, it's just all the right ways not to make a cliché full circle ending, and Miss Misery is playing and it just elevates it EVEN MORE! I really think getting Elliott Smith to write a song for this film was amazingly clever. There was 2 scenes that I thought they should have switched the songs for, because the tone of the song and scene don't fit at all. It's when "Angeles" plays in a very serious and sad scene, and "Angeles" does not have a dark tone, it has more of a uplifting, but slightly haunting sound. They should have swapped that with the scene that plays Elliott's most famous song, "Between The Bars", which is a pretty damn dark song. If Gus would have just switched those songs, it would have made the scene it home WAY harder, it did take me out the scene, because I was confused by that decision. Moving on, the plot is pretty simple, and it's not anything extremely unique, but the approach is, and the passing is perfect. I was not wanting to miss one scene in this movie, because it really grabbed all of my attention. I was not looking at the time, and I really was emotionally invested into Will Hunting. They did not make Will out to be the socially awkward and unattractive nerd that you would expect. Will is actually an asshole, but his personality is called for due to his past. I want to talk about my favorite part of this film, which is the performances. There was no one weak actor here, but Matt Damon's and Robin Williams performances are astoundingly powerful, which really gave everyone a run for there money. The most heart crushing scene in this film is really due to the way the performances were executed, and this is the scene where Will finally reveals what happened to him that has made him so damaged, and it's just so amazingly believable on both sides. I do believe Robin Williams gave his best performance ever in this film on this scene, and likewise for Matt Damon. I was crying like a child, and I never get so emotionally involved in a film, but this movie made me start looking at film as a actual art, I mean come on. If you seen this movie, you will most likely agree with me, because every time I have watched this film with someone else, the other person ends up crying because of this emotional scene. This is THE WAY you make a moving scene, I mean it's just so, dare I say epi-- I can't do it, It would be insulting to this film. I do have to say one thing I think this film is lacking, which is good cinematography. None of the scenes really show beautiful shots or unique angles, they are just pretty lack luster and average, which is a shame because I know Gus Van Sant could do some amazing shots. The reason I say this is because one of my all time favorite films, My Own Private Idaho, has some of the most amazing cinematography I have ever scene in film. I am not saying that My Own Private Idaho's cinematography is anything like "2001: A Space Odyssey" (directed and written by the one and only Stanley Kubrick, and Arthur C. Clarke), but I know Gus can pull of some amazing shots. That is basically my only complaint about this film. If you want to watch a entertaining, moving and interesting drama, you should really consider giving "Good Will Hunting" a chance.

Review title: Just watched this again after 20 years, still a masterpiece and how amazing to see Robbin William in what to me is the best performance of the movie.
Review_body: Just watched this again after 20 years, still a masterpiece and how amazing to see Robbin William in what to me is the best performance of the movie. It juxtaposes the repetitiveness and simplicity of blue collar life with the pompous, self important life of academia. Will Hunting's character is complex and its dark scars only break open in the final scenes. Still great to think that Damon and Affleck wrote this in their late 20s. Top 10 movie for me easily.

Review title: World needs to watch this movie
Review_body: I suppose everyone on the earth must watch this movie.

Review title: One of the most moving movies there is
Review_body: I first watched Good Will Hunting when I was 15, and didn't really fully appreciate how amazing the movie is. After watching it a second time, three years later, I can see this movie for what is is: a masterpiece. This movie will make you laugh, smile, cry. You cherish Robin Williams' and Matt Damon's relationship, as they both come to the realization that even though Williams is Damon's therapist, they equally both need each other. This movie is 100% a 10/10!

Review title: It was a damn good descision to watch it
Review_body: This is probably one of the best movies I have ever seen. Expecially from a story-telling point. I loved all of the Actors, surprisingly Ben Affleck as the friend character did all very well. What got me in this movie were two Things: 1st... The extremly good and complex written character of Matt Damon, what is also based on the great screenplay. 2nd...the few very deep, emotionally and well played Scenes between the Matt Damon Charactor and Robin Williams/Ben Affleck and his Girlfriend. GREAT MOVIE:

GWH, is one of the films of the 90's, thats responsible for what you could call 'new dialogue movies', I think. the movie is one of the best I've seen in that 'new' genre. Dialogue is real, natural and powerful. The other great thing about the movie is the camerawork, nice, clean, nothing fancy, the way every movie should be, but only so few movies can afford to be. Its the first movie I rated 10, not because its perfect, but mainly because its as close to perfect as any movie will get.

Fabulous movie. Williams plays the role perfect. Damon is the perfect actor for his role, and matches Williams perfect. Nice to see a good movie, with all that is needed. A must see movie, which I sure am going to watch many times.

I came into Good Will Hunting expecting a great movie. What I saw wasn't great, however it was still pretty good. I give the movie a 7.5/10, mainly due to some of the smart dialogue, and the strong performance from Robin Williams. Other than that the rest of the actors weren't that special. Matt Damon and Minnie Driver are not especially convincing, and I did not see much chemistry between the two. I hope Matt Damon's performance in Rounders is better. I think he was the only bad thing in Saving Private Ryan. Overall none of the actors are bad and the story is interesting, so you should definitely check out this movie if you haven't already.

I really love this movie. The script was wonderfully written. It combines with lots of literary elements, such as a person's quest of self, pair contrast, etc. The genius, the math professor and the shrink establish a well-constructed triangular attachment and conflict. And the three actors, especially Robin Williams, are all excellent indeed. But near the end, this gifted kid seems to change himself too fast. A bit inconvincible But still it's a touching movie, dealing with value judgment, friendship, and "carpe diem". For those who haven't seen this, go see it!

Starting slow but interesting, I found the story utterly absorbing and emotionally moving (which is, unfortunately, quite rare with me). For me it was one of those movies that you check your watch and pray it's not over yet -- it's not a story you watch to bring you from Point A to Point B -- it's the going that's good. It's a well-written, well-acted story with deep characters that you care about.Even the least-developed main relationship, Will and Skylar's, was profound. The torment that Will brought her in the end merely reflects his own, and you can feel that.I'd love to see a sequal (Better Will Hunting?) to see what they do with Will/Skylar. If it were true to life, it'd have her telling him to shove-off, but that'd make for a pretty short movie.
No matter what you like, you're guaranteed to find it in this movie.  It will make you laugh, make you cry, and make you think.  I highly recommend it to anyone.

Review title: touching as much as it gets
Review_body: Splendid! years have passed since i have seen such a movie. From the beginning till the end captures you with its plot. The effort to save a troublesome genius who doesn't like to fit in society that's something worth fighting for.I believe one of the best movies of its kind,and the end a fantastic however expected one.

Review title: This movie is 10 time better than Titanic!!!!
Review_body: I would just like to say that Matt Damon, Ben Affleck and Robin Williams kick some serious butt in this movie. I never get tired of watching it. The dialogue is so authentic and funny that you just can't help watching it more that one time. I can't wait until Matt and Ben write another movie so I can see that one.

I don't usually comment on movies, but I felt compelled to respond to some of these poor reviews. The justifications for giving Good Will Hunting a low mark seem (in general) barely thought out and petty. Someone's assertion that Affleck and Damon simply couldn't think of what to say so they kept using the "f word" stands out.  Go to this web site's Good Will Hunting memorable quote page.  There is a reason why it is one of the longest of any movie featured.Arguments that the individual story lines are unrelated and the ending is weak, lead me to believe you must have been trying to put moves on your date instead of watching the movie.  Instead, of giving us a hokey feel good ending, Affleck and Damon offer something much more insightful and honest. Will recognizes that he must deal with lingering emotional problems before he can be satisfied and successful in any profession. The ending is only a recognition of the problem, not a solution. So instead of neatly wrapped up closure, Good Will Hunting ends with something much closer to real life.
A very interesting movie. I enjoyed it. The plot was very predictable. The mathematical proofs looked kind of sketchy. And the depiction of MIT was just plain wrong.

Life is like a box of Chocolates! Robin, again phenomenal."O Captain! My Captain!"
1865 Walt Whitman

I'm amazed that this spume ever got close to winning an Oscar. It only goes to show that no matter how great the accolades or how high the rating you can still end up watching the most appalling drivel, dressed up as some kind of worthwhile exercise in entertainment. Bulls balls, last night I watched "in Bruges" and it was very good, a million miles away from this Oscar winning (substitute prohibited word).OK so now I must get down to a serious criticism of the movie, based on twenty five minutes and twenty seven seconds, after which I couldn't stomach it any more. Where do I start? Hollywood in its purest form is a place (a fantasy) where we are taken and everything is wonderful. But this kind of Hollywood is just a pretend world which is not real and not uplifting either, it neither corresponds to an ideal or a real, it is just pap. It is a depressed fantasy of a reality that never existed. The idea that you have a genius cleaning a college corridor and filling out maths equations on a blackboard, and then having a verbal fist fight with a student at a bar by quoting lots of long words and phrases at him, which will really impress the girl at the bar with the English accent is just so lame, why would anybody think that that was cleaver. Is this film just patronising uneducated but intelligent people or what, I don't know. I give up.

First word for this film is powerful, but that alone is not enough to describe the feelings i have after watching it.Good Will Hunting is fantastic in almost every way, its writing is fantastic with amazing dialogue and well fleshed out characters who you really care about. The acting is fantastic from every actor involved, I know Ben Affleck gets lots of stick but he's great also, but special praise goes to Matt Damon who portrays the troubled young man to perfection and Robin Williams, who shows what a great actor he can be in the right role, who is the grown up version of Matt Damon who never fully utilized his potential. These are ably supported by the likes of Minnie Driver and Stellen Skarsgard who also put in great supporting roles.As i said earlier the one thing that stays with you after watching it is the power of the film, this is from the performances and from the story itself. I got pulled in immediately and it never let me go it is an emotional ride but one i would recommend for everyone.

Review title: Exploring the mind of a traumatic genius
Review_body:
This film is a tale of a genius with a traumatic childhood. Orphan Will Hunting has shifted from one foster home to another. Wherever he went he got nothing but abusive foster parents. He soon realises that he is a genius, but his defence mechanism won't allow him to make use of that so he takes up the job of a janitor in M.I.T . He hoped for an opportunity to showcase his brilliance and he got that when Professor Lambeau challenged students to sopve an open problem in mathematics. Will Hunting solved all of them anonymously. Eventually Lambeau found him out and offered him a job with him. But on a condition that he goes to therapy. Will laughs it off and says he doesn't need therapy. It is then we get to see Sean(Robin Williams). He started to break down the walls Will had built in his mind and we get to see the real Will. All his life Will has kept pushing people away, he has built walls around himself to show that nothing affects him anymore. All of these just to avoid the trauma that haunts him, to repeat itself. By the end of the film Sean is able to reach out to the real Will behind all those barriers and make him drop his act of "don't care about anything or anyone" .There are certain scenes in the film which has the word perfection written all over it. The scene by the lake, where Will realises for the first time that someone has caught his trick of pushing people away. "You don't know about real loss, 'cause it only occurs when you have loved something more than you love yourself".
This film is a beautifully written journey of a traumatic genius, towards breaking down his barriers and letting go of his paranoia. It provides an emotional journey for the audience into the mind of Will Hunting.
We learn one thing from the film that is to let ourselves know that "it's not your fault".

It's an excellent story with a great cast. Two very important messages for me. Firstly, Educational opportunities for people of all backgrounds and walks of life so People can live up to their potential and have opportunity to excel in their strengths. Secondly the importance of people getting support for past traumas that have impacted their life so they can cope and go on and live productive lives.

Review title: wish i saw this in theatres!
Review_body: I love this movie beyond belief. I wish i could have seen this when it came out. Ben Affleck and Matt Damon did an excellent job at writing it and starring in it. A masterpiece. Tale of a prodigy math genius plagued by his past and his inability to connect to anyone close. The conflict with Matt Damon's character really keeps you engaged. I truly had feelings of hope, joy, and sadness. This movie is one of the ones you simply have to watch at least once. I give it a high review because it should maintain its superiority in today's dilute and mediocre film industry. Shining example of what true cinema can bring. Thank you Ben and Matt, Truly touched me in this tale.Ps. excellent movie for a date night ;)

I can confidently say this will be my favorite movie for the rest of my life. The storyline is unique, inspiring, and penetrating. The authenticity of every performance is as good as it gets, especially from Matt Damon, Robin Williams, Ben Affleck, and Minnie Driver. There are so many nuggets I circle back to time and again throughout the course of my days. I especially love the "club a baby seal" scene and the "ya suspect!" scenes. I point at my husband and yell "ya suspect - - ya you!!" at least 5 times a day. I'll never forget Sean's (Robin William's) wise words about not really arriving at a place of true wisdom until you know what it smells like in the Sistine Chapel. Until then you're just (wicked) 'smaat' and spouting out facts you've memorized from books you've checked out at the public library. I think it is such a beautiful coming of age story and it stays with, and matures with, the viewer in every season of his/her life. I can't think of another movie that has been so refreshingly authentic, so chalked full of perfect one-liners, so genuinely reflective of what it means to be a student of academia and the real world, and so powerfully representative of the magnitude of having someone just believe in you.

Review title: One of the best movie I've ever seen
Review_body: This movie touched my deeply. The acting was good and plot was also superb

A great movie and its story is great and deserves an Academy Award for Best Original Script and great acting performance from Matt Damon, Ben Affleck and the late Robin Williams, and it deserved an Academy Award in the Best Supporting Actor category.
Loved the movie. Heart touching. A bit overwhelming... God someone please give a list of movies exactly like this one.
Just the onscreen performance by all young actors specially matt damon and a great script just smashed it

Review title: A movie about a troubled young man, his past, and his future.
Review_body: This film follows the life of Will Hunting, a diamond-in-the rough genius who makes a living out of the small town Southie by working as a janitor at the prestigious MIT. After anonymously completing an equation that eventually underlines his genius, he is found out by the renown Fields medal winner Professor Lambeau. With his help, along with a psychiatrist named Sean Maguire, he learns to accept his past and move forward with his childhood problems, despite his greatest fears, witty quips, girl problems, and bad habits, that are all the more amplified by his genius and lack of willingness to take advantage of opportunities.

Review title: Good Will Hunting is still as good as it was 10 years ago...
Review_body: A few months ago I rented Good Will Hunting from a rental store right next door to me. I must say I know it came out almost 10 years ago, it is still amazing. The story was brilliant, the cast amazing, Robin Williams, who won an academy award for this, Matt Damon, who got nominated for this, Ben Affleck, and Minnie Driver, also getting nominated for this. I feel that this movie got robbed big time at the academy awards, but it did have the bad luck of coming out in the same year as titanic, l.a. confidential, and as good as it gets. I just bought this today over at best buy and it was still amazing as the first time i saw it. Loaded with a lot of comic relief. Definalty worth a rental and worth a buy as well.

Review title: A Review: Good Will Hunting by Gus Van Sant
Review_body: The Plot1997s Good Will Hunting by Gus Van Saint is an American drama story that follows a troubled unrecognized genius Will Hunting (Matt Damon) who works as a janitor at MIT. Will is ready to spend his days working a minimal wage job and drinking with his buddies on the weekend until he solves a complex math problem and gets the attention of Prof. Gerald Lambeau who decides to help Will achieve his full potential by solving math problems and getting his life back on track with the help of Dr. Sean Maguire (Robin Williams).
